01.title: is your time running
description: • Programmed, Produced & Mixed by john "joy" tay

• Used VSTs & Samples: Specifically in the outro, there is an obscured looping snippet of Linus and Lucy from the music of Snoopy Concert (SNES/ Super Famicom), found in the Selection Menu music. Meant to be disorienting but will change if deemed necessary. A small selection of sound effects are also used from the game.
• About this track: i was actually meant to ask about your fridge, why aren't you calling me back...

02.title: Light Machinery
description: • About this track: Arranged for the Commodore 64. Sound chip register refresh rate is 200 Hz.

03.title: JELLY ON TOAST
description: • Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Casio Lamb (KodamaSounds)
• Used VSTs & Samples: Serum 2 (sfx), Gameboy CGB-CPU-05 chip emulation for all sounds + drums

• About this track: Chiptune is super hard! It's a difficult genre when you're not used to so many limitations, but the end result is fun and rewarding. Jelly On Toast ended up being a playful track with no real goal in mind other than 'make it accurate!', and I'm happy with how it turned out.

05.title: Ghost Pain

• About this track: The pain of losing you still clings to me like phantom limb pain.

07.title: Crescent Signal
description: • About this track: I wanted to compose a track containing both SID and FM for quite a while now. So I used this occasion to compose a song using both SID and OPLL (YM2413). This album is an October release, so I did my best to compose a song reminiscent of an autumn night. What do you think? [SIDとFMを組み合わせて作ってみたいと前から思っていたので、この機会にSIDとOPLL(YM2413)という組み合わせで作ってみました。リリース時期が10月という事だったので秋の夜長のような雰囲気のある曲を目指したつもりなのですがいかがでしょうか？]

08.title: Crush!
description: • Used VSTs & Samples: Serum, Ozone, Purple Audio 76, Lots & lots of samples!

• About this track: Crush! A bouncy hardtek track that combines my favourite elements of hardtek and UK hardcore into one fast-paced song. Produced in mid-2023, well before my first release on KodamaSounds.

• About this track: Because the theme was adversity, I created a song which would make everyone get fired up. [テーマがVSとのことなので、アツく盛り上がれるような楽曲を制作しました。]

11.title: Kawaii Yourself
description: • Mastering Engineer: malicent (Cursed Monastery / Sigillum Azoetia)
• Used VSTs & Samples: Text to Speech

• About this track: This track, coincidentally beginning production on world suicide prevention day, is about investing in yourself as a means of fighting suicidal thoughts. It subverts the meaning of the phrase "kys", and uses the theming of kawaii, like a magical girl transition, to instead tell you to "become the one you were "meant to be", and that you are "absolutely deserving of love". The tone of the track resembles mania and conflict, the kind of feelings relevant when needing reassurance and direction to focus back on your values. Every positive upbeat message is paired with harsh bass and drums, conflicting sounds, sudden transitions in tone. Kawaii Yourself (verb) - Become the one you were always meant to be.
Become the one you were always meant to be
I see the spark adrift within you.
Fortunately, I can show you myself.

12.title: PRESS RESTART
description: • Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Casio Lamb (KodamaSounds)
• Mastering Engineer: Clipping, Limiting, Sustrative EQ
• Used VSTs & Samples: "Ethereal Vocals" (Sample Tools by CR2)

• About this track: PRESS RESTART is my first step into tech genres. MEGAREX has consistently put out works that I greatly admire and cherish, with FUGENE and Techcore Evangelix being some of my favourites -- so I thought I'd give it a shot! While I don't believe it meets the same standards, I am proud of how it turned out and hope others are too. During production I chose to do it all by ear, I had heard many lapix, Mameyudoufu, PSYQUI, and Srav3R tracks over and over again and used them as inspiration. Towards the end I got inspired to add a little bit of artcore/breaks because I found myself listening to a lot of Mili over the week, too.

13.title: The Fear of Total Nothingness
description: • Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by Sandi Setiawan

• About this track: Inspired by one of Nhato's EP. The pounding rhythm creates a gripping and adrenaline-pumping atmosphere. The title itself was inspired by an empty coffee cup and the coffee stock was out while I still finishing my song.

04.title: dauntless
description: • Mastering Engineer: malicent (Cursed Monastery / Sigillum Azoetia)

• About this track: This track has existed in some form or another for two years now. I first produced it in 2023, when I was just beginning to cut my teeth on the trance genre. I was looking to submit it to hypertrance, but something stopped me from doing so. Then, earlier this year, I revisited the project for ECLECTIC RESONANCE Escapism, but the song didn't fit into the overall hopeful mood of the album. Finally, as the deadline for ECLECTIC RESONANCE UPRISING 3 drew near, I gave the track one last shot, and third time was the charm. Though the project file itself wasn't the easiest to work with, my ideas from 2 years ago were surprisingly still compelling to me - I think it builds a great spaciousness, and the arps and gated chords sound divine. I'm happy to release this track at last.

05.title: The Headliner
description: • Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by vervid!

• About this track: hi again. it's vervid. this song has been in the works for as long as i can remember, and i'm so happy that i managed to get it done. for this song, i go under the alias "Hybrid Anomaly", which are reserved for more heavier, non-breakcore genres and styles - such as this track right here. "The Headliner" is my definition of a 'hype' song whilst also being my first genuine attempt in making UK hardcore (fused with some breakbeats here and there). hope you guys enjoy this one!

10.title: Obstruction
description: • Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by Null Specification
• Used VSTs & Samples: Hive1, Sytrus, Battery 4, Absynth 5, FM8, Massive, Omnisphere

• About this track: I tried adding some Freeform Hardcore elements to 160 BPM Schranz. Also, while you occasionally find tracks with triplet grooves in Hardtechno, it’s almost unheard of in the Schranz style, so I decided to try it out this time.

15.title: Sorrow & Demise
description: • Programmed, Produced & Mixed by PSYQUO, Volumetrique (KodamaSounds)
• Used VSTs & Samples: Brainstorm (1983) Vocal Sample

PSYQUO: Hi, it's PSYQUO. This time collabing with Volumetrique, we made a Tech DnB track. For the concept I had while making parts of the track - the song reflects the many things we see in the world. This sadness and hopeless is what many of us are feeling right now. I hope these feelings come through the song. As for the collab, I originally approached Volumetrique to make a Schranz track, but after a bit of  back and forth, we decided to do DnB instead. (Schranz collab when) A big thank you to Volumetrique for making the track whole!

Volumetrique: Dan here. I've finally had the opportunity of releasing a track as Volumetrique on KodamaSounds... And it's a Tech DnB banger with feelings™, inspired by the likes of IMANU, The Caracal Project, C&K... With the massive help and gorgeous sound design skills of PSYQUO, we've cooked a snappy, tech-neurofunk-ish track. You won't find any snappier drums anywhere else at M3 ;) ( ok, maybe at Supire's :P ). I've been immensely carried by PSYQUO, who also initiated the collab and I'm deeply thankful for the opportunity, through the highs and the lows. We ended up crunching hard to finish this~! And about that Schranz collab... maybe we'll get to start it in Japan together ;;) Enjoy!!! 🙇⚡🚵
